title: Letters to the Editor:  Contemplating Notre Dame
text:
How sad to find out that Father Gilles Drouin and his fellow remodelers never understood why people came to Paris's Notre Dame Cathedral ("An Incendiary Plan for Notre Dame" by Michael Lewis, Cultural Commentary, Dec. 1). They came to sit quietly in a pew and let themselves be overwhelmed by how much faith it must have taken to build this monument over hundreds of years. If they had wanted to see a Disney laser show, they would have gone to the Louvre Museum.

Gerhard Popp

Webster, N.Y.
